captions.text: Malegaon has many identities.

Among them is an
obsession for films.

Theatres are packed on Fridays,
because power-looms are closed.

A worker is exhausted after
a week of hard work at the looms.
His mind is numb.
so he watches a film on Friday,

surrenders his consciousness,
and imagines himself on the screen.
Trades his reality for a fantasy.
Our town has two faces.

There's the river-on that side,
our Hindu brothers.
This side, the Muslims.

And it's a Muslim majority.
They are the ones who make films.

Our Mollywood is run
mainly by the Muslims.

Why the divide? There
is continuous communal tension.

So people stick to their sides,
never cross over.
They are scared.
But they love films, both sides.

No Hindus. No Muslims.
No Sikhs. No Christians.

Shahrukh Khan costs four rupees.
So does Titanic.
Don costs six rupees, Madam.

If you want to look
like Shahrukh Khan,

we charge only 101 rupees ($2.5)
for the complete look, no more.

It is more for Sanjay Dutt,
151 rupees ($4).

That's because his style is
different. More hair at the back.

In my father's time,
people would worship actresses.
Today they worship heroes!

Where is the world going?
I don't understand!

There is no other source
of entertainment in Malegaon,

besides the video theatres
and video parlours.

The showroom that you
see used to be a video parlour.

I used to screen different
kinds of films here.

Comedy, action,
horror, Jackie Chan. Jet Li.

Watching them,
I dreamt of making films myself.
So, I bought a camera and...

...and started shooting
wedding videos.

During that time,
I made some films.
While making those films,

I realised I should make a parody,
a comedy.

So, I thought I'd remake
the hit Bollywood film, Sholay.
I realised that..

people still love Charlie Chaplin,
even though it's 50 years old.

But no one likes action
or horror films from that period.

A comedy from back
then is still a hit.
A comedy lasts forever.

It is eternal. That's why 
I decided to make a comedy film.

I shot Malegaon ke Sholay on
a VHS camera and edited VCR to VCR.

I made the film
for the thrill of it.
Spent 50,000 rupees ($1000) on it.

When I played it
at my video parlour,
the public loved it.
The film ran for 2 months.
Tickets were on the black market.

Malegaon ka Sholay
was a huge hit in Malegaon.

Nasir Bhai had his own video
hall where he played the film.

The response was so immense
that for the next week or two,

our Sholay was
the talk of the town.
Here, they mostly produce remakes.

And they transpose the
film to the local context,

the local dialect,
which the public enjoys greatly.
'They're speaking our language...'

Things are improving now,
with computers.

So for the first time,
I'm trying chroma.
I'm making Malegaon's Superman.

Because, so far,
no-one has messed with Superman.
No-one has made a parody of it.

First I took on Bollywood.
Now I'm taking on Hollywood.
Computers?

Computers. We're going to
use chroma for the whole thing.

You'll have to
embrace this new age.
What was that - HIV? No. Your VHS?
You'll have to leave all that.

You're now in the mobile age,
electronic age.
Computer's the way forward.

Only then will your Superman fly,
otherwise it's too difficult.

Some Hollywood films show a 'making
of' at the end...Like Jackie Chan...

I saw chroma being used in a film
once. That's where I got the idea.
I've bought some cloth. Will it do?
This is for the back.

The underwear won't be the
usual sort. It'll have this effect.
Hmm. Alright.

This is Superman's
dress...the back...
The monogram 'M' on the back...
It should be skin-touch.
I'll bring Shafique to you.
Thanks.
This was our video hall.

This is where the
projector was. Here.
It'd play on that.

I didn't go anywhere
to learn how to make films.

At the video hall, I'd select
different kinds of films to screen.

After those,
Hindi films seemed boring.
Weak direction, I thought.

So, my rehearsal happened
watching English films.

I learnt master angles,
master lighting, the works.

So, mainly,
my education was at the video hall.

I took clippings from newspapers,
of films that played in Bombay...
...and played the same films here.
'Abyss' ran here for a whole month.
Here's Sholay.

I used to make these myself,
to put up.
See, this is what obsession does.

I just wanted to
do something different.

And now, after all this time,
the story has come to this.
Have to translate this.
How does Superman fly?

Nasir Bhai said he
was making Superman.

When he said Superman
was going to fly,

we felt like all of Mollywood
was going to fly along with him!
Bombay - 296 KMS.
I've come from Malegaon.

I am making a film.
Malegaon's Superman.

Hello. Sir,
I've come from Malegaon.

I am making a film.
Malegaon's Superman.

I wanted to confirm what software
will give best results for chroma.
Okay. Okay.

The price he quoted...it's
not in my budget.
Thank you.

He quoted Rs.
2,00,000 ($4000). What do I do?

For that amount,
I can make 4 films.
I have all the marks.

I just don't understand.
That's why...no scissors yet.

By the way, four people
are working on the script.

I'm hoping to make it
as different as possible.
Akram, Hamid Subhani,
our...

...Farogh.
Farogh Jafri. He is also involved.

I want to make it
as strong as possible.

The script, although it shouldn't be so,
has been written very mathematically.

You open with a blast, so that you
have the audience's concentration,

then the story starts,
then you build the anti-climax,

then towards the climax.
Shouldn't be so.

It should be from the
heart - start to finish.

For example Tata mobile
phones have poor network.

Now, Superman is on the
ground and someone calls him.

He says, 'Hello,
hello?' but can't hear a thing.

So he says, 'Wait.',
flies up and says, 'Now, go ahead.'
At one point, the villain says,
'I want to see every Indian child,
and every Indian, young or old...

...spitting on the streets, in restaurants,
on walls, in toilets, everywhere.
Because I love filth.
I love filth!

This lady's first
job was in my film.

And after that, she got
a chance in TV serials and...
...now she's in a Nokia ad.

Today, there's a poster of a girl
who's worked under my direction.

It makes me happy, stuff like this.
One hopes for more of this.
What was her name?

Don't remember.
It's been a long time!

I didn't know what an
assistant was, nor editing.

Much later I learnt what
I was doing was called editing.
I thought it was a one-man-show.

I didn't even know there were
different departments for each job.

Later I learnt the cameraman,
director,

make-up man,
editor are all different people.

I wondered, 'How do different
people make one film?'

Because a film comes
from one man's head.

I used to think a single
individual makes a film.
Understood?

I've already cut the underwear.
-Really?
Stick this up here.

If you like, you can watch
the film as well. Okay, I'm off.
Superman's on his way.
Switch the lights off! It's 11pm.
Hey, don't switch the light on!

Switch the light on now.
-See, Altaf Bhai.
What an effect!
Let's see...
Look straight ahead.
This will stay out. For comedy.

What say, Altaf Bhai?
More or less, huh?

I didn't think I'd
ever get such a big role.

I was so thrilled,
I didn't sleep the whole night.
How will it be? How will I fly?
When I was a kid...

the first film my brother showed 
me was an Amitabh Bachchan film.

I didn't know what a TV was,
or who Amitabh Bachchan was,
But after I watched the film...

I'd style my hair like him,
behave like him...

...walk like him, talk like him -
'Hey'...all of that.

After this film,
people will call out to me...
'Hey, Superman! Come here!'
In this comedy, Superman is...
...a victim of many diseases.
He is very troubled.

While flying, because
of pollution in the atmosphere,
he gets asthma.
He falls to the ground, coughing.

Flying in circles,
he feels dizzy, and sits down.
"Malegaon?"
"Malegaon?", asks Superman.
"Where they have the power looms?"

Hello? You're coming right?
Hamid's also here.
I can't make time because of work.
Because all of us have jobs.

Jobs mean food.
And food means being able to walk.

And if you can walk,
you can get to the meeting.

"If you need anything,
I'll call you."

"Stay in contact.
Your phone number is 007."
What the-?

The camera comes
through the clouds...

-over the river. You're
hiring a helicopter, right?

When a writer has
a thought in his head,

whatever his vision, he'll
never achieve more than 20% of it.

Whether it's 'Titanic',
the output is 20%.

But to live with the
other 80% in your head...
...the vision...the characters...
...no one can understand that pain.
And no money can compensate for it.

Anywhere in the world,
being a writer is a tough job.
What are you making?
This? Er...what are we making?

He's directing me.
I'm just making it.

So you don't know
what you're making?

No. I'm just being directed.
Maybe it's Superman's cape.

It's the chroma cloth.
On it...we'll...

I thought of something.
I don't know if I'll use it.

There'll be a kid
in a Spiderman costume.

Superman's dad says, "If you fail
in your mission, we'll send the kid..."

Thought about Batman too.
But Batman's not a big hit.
So, two kids, sitting there.

'You go. But if you fail,
we'll send the kids.'

Tell me what you want me to do,
Shafique.
Because I'm not getting you.
Why are you behaving like this?
I am a professional photographer.
That aside, I like to make films.

Cinematographer.
Plus I also direct.

Also, I edit my own films,
do the background music.

Just tell me what you want,
and it'll happen.
Here is our Superman.

Superman,
the film's not even begun...

Are you going to keep this up?
Tell me honestly.

I swear,
tell me if this is going to work.

Otherwise I'll put
someone else in your place.

So, during the Superman shoot,
will you go to work?
No, I'll take leave.

If I go to work,
Nasir Bhai will yell at me.

If I work all night and
shoot the next morning...
I'm going to be falling asleep.

I was late today and
you saw what happened.

If I'm late at the shoot,
imagine what will happen. ...No?
Keep going.
Lift your head up.
This way...sideways...
Do this.
You concentrate here!
Let's have two people lift him up.
You guys sit.

Explain the situation!
- We lift him and turn, right?
Yes, but lift him first!
Got him?
Stand still!
Forget it. Come on.
Yes, keep turning.

This time, we want to
attempt something technical.

You could call it
a technical comedy.

So, I think maybe we'll try something
like the fight sequences in Matrix.
At least we'll attempt it.
His stomach's disappeared.

Yeah, we're doing
something about it.
See. Success!!

Wham! And Superman'll
fly out of a train!

Look, we made Superman fly!

You like it?

Now Superman will fly in Malegaon!
-Hmm? -Yes!
Did you also make him fly?
Did I make him fly?
Success! Yay!
Akram! -It really worked, huh!
I need make-up.
Give me lipstick.
That's wrong.
It's a fair price, my friend.

If I find something similar,
can I bring this back, brother?
Sirs, I have three marbles.

Sridevi, Aishwarya Rai,
Rani Mukherjee.
One goes to drink milk.
Another to the cinema.

And the third in hand.
All are separate.

Gone from my palm.
And two together.

If this goes,
then they will be three.
Best!
Show me mobile phones.
Come on, man!

- How the hell are you holding it?
- The grip wasn't right.
No, no!
I'll put it in a box.

I was thinking of watching
'Double Jeopardy' today.
I like the slogan very much.
So, I think I'll watch this today.

Steal some of the thinking,
some ideas,

and try and sell it
to a producer in Bombay.
I'll make a subject out of it.

But what I want
to write is a comedy.

I know that once it clicks,
then all these years...

That singular moment, it
will make up for ten years of this.
One singular moment.

But when will that moment come?
It should, though. It will.

And one way or the other,
I have to do it.
Now there's no turning back.

Because I've blasted
all roads to go back.
I cannot return.
Farogh!
Farogh!
Come on, man!
It's the first day!
Sure you'll come? Shall I leave?

I was asked to come
by 11 for the shoot.

but in Malegaon there
is no sense of time.

Two people come with me.
Hanif Bhai, that is your den.
Hey, get the stand!
Start the make-up, Nasir Bhai.

How is it going to
fit his 24-inch waist?
Hey Mukim! Come here NOW!

First, you come late,
then you just stand around!
The goggle will be worn like this.
Like this.
Why are you laughing?

What sort of a role is this, Uncle?
Aren't we looking like cartoons?

Like we're about
to perform surgery.

You are in the background,
there is no close-up. -No? -No!
They won't be seen?

-No, no close -up. I'm going to
repeat you guys elsewhere.

So you'll have to
become jokers again.
This is Malegaon.

If you appear in a film,
your value increases.

It doesn't matter
what your role is.
You could be a joker or a star.
Hey, Superman!

While you're there,
put those poles up in a row.

These were lying in the junkyard.
I thought I could use it for effect.
It would...

Daddy, Papa,

Start!
Son...

...most unique village.
-Okay, enough.
Hanif Bhai, run to that side!

Please!
This shot looks good. Hurry!
Start!
Go quickly!
Off you go!
Tata, farewell, goodbye!

What? Are you packing up?
-Yeah, pack-up!
He's saving Superman!
Pass me one.
Give Nasir one.
Here, Nasirbhai.
What have I copied?
This Superman is not a copy!

Someone can't dress in

Locations are different.
Music, artists, story different.

All stories are the same.
Hero, heroine, villain.

There is music,

Our film is done differently.

Locations aren't the same.
What have I copied?
I am not making it as it is.
I'm changing it. Indianizing it.

I don't think this is a copy.
Do you...you...think so?

Come, come, come!
Hey, spit on him!
Speed up the rickshaw!
Careful!

Superman was such a big hit.
The first part.
There was a second, third, fourth.

Why did he remake
the fifth like the first?
The story could have moved on.

He couldn't give it the
effect it should have had.
He had very little graphics.
What do people want to see?

If there is Superman,
they want to see him fly.

In my story, I am going
to try and give him movement.
Make it fun to watch.

All stories go on.
Anyone can say dialogues.
Pull him out!
We've got a lot more to do...
Shove him in.
Hold on. Don't move the rickshaw.
Go.

We don't have the facilities,

That's what is special.

We don't have great voices,

This is what is exceptional.

We have no weapons.

Look up.

Why don't the women in
Malegaon work in these films?

It is not a mindset
that exists in our town.

See, 75  % of the
population is Muslim.
There are many restrictions.

We, men, will dance on
the streets and earn money...
...and feed our families.

But we can't send
our women out to work.
Don't let anyone come.

But what if the
woman wants to work?
But there is running the house.

There is no greater
job than that for a woman.
Start washing.
Straighten your hair and scarf.

Basically, there is a
problem with the way we think.
And that comes from our poverty.

Because we can't
complete our education,

our thinking doesn't develop.
It's a vicious cycle.

People make films
for various reasons.

Some make it for money,
some as a passion.

For me, it's the passion.
Then I don't see how much I spend.

Sometimes I borrow
money from my brother.

Then if need be, I sell
advertisement space in the film.

Earlier, I'd taken ads
for Ismail cigarettes, Rima Soap.

This time we are doing
an ad for Lalle Milk Centre.
So, we'll get something from them.
We are very famous in Malageon.
Ask anyone about us.
Nasir Bhai suggested we do an ad.

a shoot is taking place here today.

I don't want them

I treat it like a hobby.
There's no future in it.

They'll forget about real work,
get busy doing this.
They strut about town like heroes.

Nothing is difficult. If you

In Malegaon,
most people work in the looms.

Even people from good
homes are compelled to do this.

My father had said,
'Don't ever work in a loom.'
But times are hard.

We've had this power problem
for the last 7-8 years.

All businesses in Malegaon
depend on power, but...

If the power goes for 8-10 hours
a day, what will a worker earn?

From making 1000
rupees ($20) a week...

...he's now making
400-600 rupees ($8-$10).

Can't feed a family
with 400 rupees.

This too, is our life, although
it might seem like a story to you.

It's titled 'A conversation
with the Moon'.

Oh, moon. Wandering, veiled,
in the dark reaches of the night,

Leave, for this ghetto
is not worthy of you.

This ghetto, where in the dead
of night, honour is auctioned away,

where human beings
are just another currency,
and love is a dishonoured word.

Where is it always
the season of tyranny.

And nothing but
the agony of torture.
Where the children of the poor,
from birth to eventual manhood...

...only hear the singular pounding
of the looms, like a mother's lullaby.

Oh moon. Wandering, veiled
in the dark reaches of the night.
Leave. Leave my ghetto in peace.
I was scared!
See!
I want to see every Indian child,
and every Indian, young or old...

Akram is cutting his hair.

Bisleri water.

films for a year or so.
I'm from Dhulia. It's nearby.

hot dances, I can do.

don't let women act.

I mean, depending on the family...
how the family is.

I've noticed women
here don't live frankly.

There's the college,
there's the Municipal Corporation.

And there are the factories
that house the power looms
And there's the ancient fort.
It'll play now. Listen to it.
Superman. I am Malegaon's Superman.
Superman. I am Malegaon's Superman.
Superman. I am Malegaon's Superman.
I'll fly you around the whole town,

Driven by the loom
sound - that's Malegaon.
Hindus, Muslims, Sikhs, Christians
I am loved by all.
Superman. I am Malegaon's Superman.
Superman. I am Malegaon's Superman.
Superman. I am Malegaon's Superman.
Go straight, okay? Wait.
Start!

The camera zooms into him.
That's why I used it.
Climb.
Lower it slowly.

Don't climb down.
I haven't finished.

They promise they'll come.
Then there's no sign of them.

This is why I don't
feel like making films.
Because of this tension.
Get me some water.
Don't look anywhere, stay.
We're about to start. Come on.

Last night, we had a meeting
for fighting direction.

But what we had planned won't work
because the location isn't right.

The owner of the other factory
refused to let us shoot...
...saying we disturbed their work.
Now we've to compromise.
Shut the gate!

We are from the
Homeguards Department.

This is our hobby.
You know me, I'm an artiste also.
I asked them to come along also.

"Take your badges off.
We've a film shoot to do".

They are very happy to
co-operate for a film shoot.
Hello, baby!
Hey, why...? Why is he running?
Once more!
Throw them off!
Hey, Shafique!
Watch it!
Hit only these people.
Fall, you!
Fall!
Attack!
Finally caught the rascal!
Don't hurt him!
Tape 9 or 10?
Start!
Very good!
Wait! Once more.

Hit his bald head.
I'm shooting the head.
Take it out slowly.
Keep them open. Open. Hey, man!
Wait!

Come when I call.
Who are you listening to?
Get up, you!
Look her in the eye.

Look straight at her,
Shafique, you rascal.
This look is fine for Mollywood.

If this was Hollywood, I'd have 
2 or 3 pretty girls by my side.
-some guns...
Your magnificent veil of flowers.

These guests sing
in praise of Allah,

for today we obey
the Prophet's decree.

Shall we make him wear
his Superman costume?

Isn't he handsome? I'm her
aunt's daughter. I live nearby.

What is difficult about this?
-Nothing.
Stay close to the mic.

I'm her aunt's daughter.
I live close by.

- Say it like that.
- I am feeling very nervous.

Say it slowly,
the way we talk, naturally.

I was laughing;
I told Uncle I couldn't do it.

Normally,
if it is a one-hour long project...

...with dubbing and
some background music...

...we take a lump-sum of Rs.
10- 11,000 ($250)
Our Mr. Gaitonde said...
On this...

one project takes
maximum 15 days. Totally.
With dubbing and everything.
Will you work on my film? Come on!

I'm making a film,
Malegaon's Superman.
Careful!

Mukim, I'll have
to tear your pants.

To gain something,
you have to lose something.
Trupti ji!

This is very disgusting.
I'll tell you what happens.
Fan him. Move your hands, Mukim.
Feet together!
My back and chest are hurting.
I'm in great pain.
I'll have to take pain coolers now.
But it was fun.
A lot of fun.
Best!

This is the first
time I'm trying chroma...

...hanging Superman
and the other guy...

Now I'm worried about how
I'm going to handle the heroine.
Move quickly!
Look here and there as you fly.
I hope this doesn't break.

It won't.
Hold each other as you fly.
You can hold his shoulder.
Drop your scarf.
Let your scarf hang from this side.
It's forbidden to see such things.

Allah's followers must
abstain from all this.
I won't look there.
Absolutely wonderful.
The botheration has lessened.
The tension...
I'm feeling lighter.

The powerloom workers are
victims of poverty and hunger.
He pays Rs. 100 for food supplies,

...where the government
should give it for free.
This is my demand!
Did you capture what we shot today?

I still have to do that.
I'm making this sharper.

I'm planning to go to
Bombay to assist a director.

But while I struggle to find a
big director, for those 4-6 months,

the simple thing for me to
do is sing at a beer bar at night,
and struggle for work in the day.

In pursuing this dream, I don't
want to lose what I already have.

In case, things don't work out there,
at least I can come back to this.

I've never considered
moving to Bombay.
This is my passion.

I'll never be able
to work under anyone.

Even if I am offered a job,
I won't go.
I am happy here.
There is this one thing on my mind.

I have to go to Bombay,
do something.

300 kms. For 15 years,
I've been heading towards Bombay.
But Bombay isn't any closer.

This video hall had
been shut for 7 years.
This is also temporary.
For the trial.

I'd like to run it like I used to.
Back in the day.
Feels nice.

This reminds me
of how it used to be.

There is one role I really want
to do. A big role in a big film.
Amitabh Bachchan's.
I've done the small role.

Now, I want to be Amitabh
Bachchan for an entire film.
I dream of building a bungalow,
Of being a star. That's my dream!

But you should always
speak out your dreams,
because they don't get fulfilled.
Unless of course, He wills it.

Life is full of tears
and sorrow anyway.

But it is very difficult
to find any laughter.

Laughter is...precious.
And very important.
Where can you...I mean...
How do I...
How do you make a person happy?

This is probably the only way.
No give and take.

You can make someone
happy anywhere in the world.

comments.author: Prakash Pankaj

comments.text:
*Supermen of Malegaon*

A small town tucked away in the heart of India, Malegaon is fraught with 
communal tension and under economic depression. To escape the harsh reality 
of their world, its people seek refuge in the fantastical world of 
cinema. This passion for cinema has driven a group of cinema enthusiasts to 
create their own films - quirky, low budget, socially aware and notoriously 
funny spoofs of Bollywood films. Spurred on by their success they now 
aspire to take on Hollywood and Superman.

Click on the CC button for subtitles.

Discovered via http://www.reddit.com/r/Documentaries﻿

comments.text:
Fantastic and inspiring. I have a lot of friends in the movies and I have 
recommended this to every one of them. If this doesn't kick them forward, I 
don't know what will! The way I see it, this is a really really good 
'making of' a really really bad B grade movie. That in itself is genius! 
But the quality of the movie is irrelevant here, because it shows that big 
dreams can curdle the blood of the most common, simple humans. Well done, 
Faiza, Shaikh Nasir and everyone involved.
